document_data.name: Water
document_data.mainbody: The element of '''water''' was one of the four fundamental building blocks of matter and the source of all fluidity, essential for life, liable to transformations but cyclically reverting to its basic liquid nature.
document_data.Cosmology:
Water manifested its position in the cosmos as the [[Elemental Plane of Water]], one of the [[Inner Planes]].<ref> The element was also represented there in living form as [[water elemental]]s.

The ruler over the [[portfolio]] of water in [[Faer√ªn]] and [[Zakhara]] was the [[elemental lord]] [[Istishia]].<ref> The [[archomental]] [[Olhydra]] also proclaimed her wish to dominate the element by calling herself Princess of Evil Water,<ref>{{Cite web/Villains: Cult of the Crushing Wave}} though she had made no obvious attempts to challenge the Water Lord.<ref>[[Monte Cook]] (1998). ''[http://www.dnd-wiki.org/wiki/Publication:Planescape_Monstrous_Compendium_Appendix_III Planescape Monstrous Compendium Appendix III]''. ([[TSR, Inc]]), p. 17. ISBN 0-7869-0751-7.

A number [[Toril]]ian powers were concerned less directly with the elemental aspect of water, but with its various appearances in the Realms: [[Deep Sashelas]],<ref> [[Umberlee]], [[Ulutiu]]<ref> and [[Valkur]] with the sea and oceans; [[Isis]],<ref> [[Sebek]]<ref> and [[Shajar]]<ref> with rivers; [[Aerdrie Faenya]],<ref> [[Anhur]],<ref> [[Azul]]<ref> and [[Jisan]]<ref> with rain; and [[Eldath]] with springs, pools, and waterfalls.<ref>

Magic.School of elemental water:
Many [[magic]]al spells utilized the element of water.<ref> Elemental water was recognized as a "school of effect" (rather than one of the eight traditional [[schools of magic]]).<ref> Wizards specializing in this school were called water [[elementalist]]s.In some areas of the world of [[Mystara]], water elementalists were called hydromancers.<ref>
Water was opposed to the [[element of fire]], both as a school of magic and as a worldview.<ref>

Magic-users in Zakhara had a similar but not identical notion of water magic in the form of the [[Sea (province)|province of sea]].<ref>

Likewise, the [[wu jen]] of [[Kara-Tur]] divided spells into five elemental groups, including water.
Magic.Divine water magic: A number of deities granted [[Divine magic|divine spells]] that relied on the element, either in the form of the [[elemental water sphere]],<ref> or the [[water domain]].<ref><ref>

document_data.Celestial bodies:
[[Spelljammer|Spacefarers]] also used the four elements to distinguish different types of celestial bodies present in the [[crystal sphere]]s.<ref>
